result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dyllon Malik Johnson

records.addlTxt:
10:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dyllon Malik Johnson in court.  Attorney Jeremy Chavez in court for Dyllon Malik Johnson. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Chavez is requesting one more adjournment as he is waiting for additional digital discovery to review. The State does not object. Court adjourns.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:32 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Dyllon Malik Johnson, appeared with Attorney Jeremy Chavez.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Chavez is requesting an adjournment as he still needs to review discovery with the DE. No objection from the State. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Chavez.  Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Chavez states he has just been appointed. STC set to 08/24/22 at 1:30.

  State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
